intro: Hemitelia stokesii, commonly known as Stokes' hemitelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of St. Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), providing structural support in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
